featured.text: Much of the forest land where tea is grown in Assam is flat and thus farmers must dig drainage trenches to prevent water from accumulating and hurting the shrubs.
But baby elephants, not used to negotiating rough ground, may easily fall into the trenches and get hurt; and once injured, they might not be able to climb out.
Furthermore, elephants are known to resist leaving their sick or dying behind, and a herd may linger at a trench with a trapped baby for hours, reluctant to move on until all hope is lost.

other.text: The trenches, however, can be death traps for the elephants.
They cannot find a safe shelter when climbing out of the trenches.
The elephants use the trenches to roam around the tea gardens.
Why do farmers in Assam dig trenches in tea gardens? (A) To protect tea trees.
What does “it” in the last paragraph refer to? (A) To certify elephant-friendly trenches and organizations.

definition.zh_def: 壕溝；深長的挖掘，通常用於防禦或排水。
definition.en_def: A long, narrow ditch or excavation, often used for defense or drainage.
definition.example: The soldiers dug a trench to protect themselves from enemy fire.
